title.narrative: QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2: Education institutions have evidence and enhanced capacities to effectively provide quality and inclusive education, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and youth benefit from quality and inclusive education and skills development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: Education institutions have evidence and enhanced capacities to effectively provide quality and inclusive education

description.narrative: In 2021, the breakthrough in ensuring equitable access to digital and blended education was achieved by developing the BiH technical standards that will enable stakeholders to provide optimum ICT equipment for schools throughout the country. UNICEF worked with education authorities to rapidly respond to the escalating teachers’ needs for professional development and provided trainings for 1,521 teachers (1,252 females). UNICEF generated momentum for the introduction of AT in education and partnered with the lead international experts. 291 children (107 girls) on the move were included in formal education while 1,314 children (381 girls) were provided with non-formal education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
